items.title: Beyond single-model AI: How architectural design drives reliable multi-agent orchestration
items.description: Successful AI agents require enterprises to orchestrate interactions, manage shared knowledge and plan for failure.

items.title: OpenAI updates Operator to o3, making its $200 monthly ChatGPT Pro subscription more enticing
items.description: Operator remains a research preview and is accessible only to ChatGPT Pro users. The Responses API version will continue to use GPT-4o.

items.title: The battle to AI-enable the web: NLweb and what enterprises need to know
items.description: Microsoft's NLWeb protocol transforms websites into AI-powered apps with conversational interfaces.

items.title: The 3 biggest bombshells from this week’s AI extravaganza
items.description: Enterprises looking to build with AI should find plenty to look forward to with the announcements from Microsoft, Google & Anthropic this week.

items.title: Why enterprise RAG systems fail: Google study introduces ‘sufficient context’ solution
items.description: Google's "sufficient context" helps refine RAG systems, reduce LLM hallucinations, and boost AI reliability for business applications.
